MONDAY Aug PERIOD   HealthDay News  About half of older adults  percent have heard of the new vaccine against respiratory syncytial virus RSV according to the National Poll on Healthy Aging released online on Aug PERIOD  PERIOD

The poll which comes from the University of Michigan in Ann Arbor was administered July  through Aug PERIOD  to  people aged  to  years PERIOD

The poll showed that  percent of respondents said they were very interested and another  percent said they were somewhat interested PERIOD However only  percent of older adults who reported their health as fair or poor had heard of the RSV vaccine versus  percent of those who rated their health as good to excellent PERIOD Regardless of whether or not they had previously heard of the vaccine before the poll more than  percent of those with a chronic health condition said they were very or somewhat interested in getting the vaccine PERIOD

 poll senior advisor Preeti Malani M.D. from the University of Michigan said in a statement PERIOD

Report

Originally published on consumer.healthday.com part of the BLOX Digital Content Exchange PERIOD
